Description: Nine beads in different shapes and materials. A: Double conical bead made of whitish stone with greyish inclusions. Well smoothed. Drilled from one side only. B: One barrel-shaped bead, now broken, made of a glass or glass-like material, now in a corroded pearlescent colour. C: Two spherical beads made of glass, in two sizes, now corroded and pearlescent in colour. D: Two cylindrical segmented beads, made of white faience, each has two segments preserved. E: Three disc-shaped beads, made of ostrich eggshell.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
